result.execSummary:
The defendant Cullen H Glynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Cullen H Glynn was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Associated with Charge #7

Defendant Cullen H Glynn in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 2 & 3 and 7. Linda D. and Jim D. made statements. Firearm admonishments given to defendant. Tracey A. made statements. 
Court orders the following: 

Cts. 2  - Court orders the conditional release plan be adopted and reads the conditions into the record.
             Court imposes the plan for 3 years. 
             Defendant to voluntarily provide a blood sample - results to be sealed.
             No contact w/victims or their residences.   
             Restitution to be directed to the DA's Office of $7.832.22 from the bail posted. Balance of Bail to be refunded. 
             Court costs of $278.00 (includes DRGOD)  to be paid as a condition of probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
             DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
                   
Cts. 3  - Court orders the conditional release plan be adopted and reads the conditions into the record.
             Court imposes the plan for 3 years. 
             Defendant to voluntarily provide a blood sample - results to be sealed.
             No contact w/victims or their residences.   
             Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
             DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive

Ct. 7:   
 - Withheld sentence for 1 year Probation -  concurrent - 1 day credit if revoked
 - Fine totaling $1,335.00 (includes $200.00 Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 27 days jail consecutive 
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Take all medications prescribed. Cooperate with psychiatrist and any treatment.   
- 6 month suspension of Driver's License - forthwith

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cullen H Glynn in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 and 3 but not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 7.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Cts. 1, 4, 5 & 6 dismissed and read-in. Defendant to be evaluated pursuant to 971.17(2) on Cts. 2 and 3 on an outpatient basis by Department of health services. Court will put the matter over for 60 days for sentencing.  JOC to enter on Ct. 7. Conditional release plan to be prepared. Defendant to cooperate fully with the evaluation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum, filed by Dr. Collins.
Hearing on September 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Updated report to be filed by Dr. Collins no later than 08/27/2014.   Defendant to cooperate fully with Dr. Collins. State to contact Dr. Collins. Defendant Cullen H Glynn in court with attorney Jonathan A LaVoy.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading to information.
